basic.floral_language:
Haworthia cooperi var. truncata 
Floriography: cute, pure, elegant
Has crystal-clear and bright leaves in fresh green, a little more transparent but smaller than Haworthia cooperi, leaf surface marked by several longitudinal stripes, fleshy, closely arranged in a rosette with the middle ones higher, cute and lovely, suitable for desks, tables, and windowsills, very high ornamental value.
Likes gentle sunshine, avoid direct strong sunlight, has a short dormant period under summer high temperature, need shade properly under scattered light. Flowers are white.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, white flowers
basic.color: Leaf color green to gray green, leaf turns light red brown with too much strong light

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Use half shade for care, put in places with scattered light
maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce water in summer
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply once every 1-2 months in spring and autumn
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
